Posts.Content: Dec 19, 2013 09:53AM curlyowl wrote: I am 49 years old and had a total hysterectomy in 2005 and went for a mamogram last Monday, I was called Wednesday to have spot compression and an ultrasound, BI-RADS: 0. I went because my right arm, armpit and right breast are sore and aching into my rib cage that started in October, I had felt a very tiny lump and then it seemed to have gone away. My mamogram has shown a "dominant 8mm nodule at the nipple line at 6 o'clock. Scattered benign nodularity is also seen bilaterally in the lateral aspects. These are likely cysts or certainly intramamary lymph node on the left." I am now waiting the results of the spot compression and ultrasound. I also now noticed the left breast is larger and the veins are really prominent.
Posts.Title: Waiting...trying to stay positive lulu70 curlyowl
